title: Plattenspitze (Schladming Tauern)
text:
The Plattenspitze or Plattenspitz is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a>, 2,294 metres high (another source 2,293 m) above the village of <a href="Obertauern">Obertauern</a> and on the territory of the municipality of <a href="Tweng">Tweng</a>, Austria. Its summit lies within the <a href="Schladming%20Tauern">Schladming Tauern</a> range and is usually traversed by climbers making for the <a href="Gamskarlspitze">Gamskarlspitze</a> (2,411 m) to the south.
Neighbouring peaks are the Hundskogel (2,238 m) and Gamskarlspitze (2,411 m).
On top of the Plattenspitze is a tower which acts as a <a href="passive%20repeater">passive repeater</a>.
One of the lifts of the Obertauern ski region, the "Plattenkarbahn" runs up the mountain to the <a href="cirque">cirque</a> beneath the summit.
